Class MVTSDatasetGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • MVTSDatasetGenerator
  • public class MVTSDatasetGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MVTSDatasetGenerator()
      default data set constructor
      MVTSDatasetGenerator​(int features, int sequenceLength)
      constructor for data sets with no anomaly
      MVTSDatasetGenerator​(int features, int sequenceLength, int anomalies, int[] range)
      constructor for data sets with anomalies

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.Double>> generateDataset()
      method that allows to generate the multi-variate time series data set the method also checks if it is required the introductio of anomalies and randomly adds them to the series accordingly to the settings of the constructor
      java.util.Vector<java.lang.Double> generateSingleTimeSeries()
      method that allows to generate a single time series the time series is randomly generated on the basis of a coin toss strategy that leverages the 0/1 variable sRand: - when sRand is 0 the time series is computed as sin[(t-t0)/w] + lambda * epsilon - when sRand is 1 the time series is computed as cos[(t-t0)/w] + lambda * epsilon
      int getAnomalies()
      accessor method
      int getFeatures()
      accessor method
      int[] getRange()
      accessor method

      method that allows to print the data set content
      void printParams()
      method that allows to print the information about the constructor's settings
      void saveDataset​(java.lang.String filename, java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.Double>> dataset)
      method that allows to save the data set into a csv file
      void setAnomalies​(int anomalies)
      accessor method that allows to set the number of anomalies
      void setFeatures​(int features)
      accessor method that allows to set the number of features

      accessor method that allows to set the duration of the anomalies

    • Constructor Detail

      • MVTSDatasetGenerator

        public MVTSDatasetGenerator​(int features,
                            int sequenceLength,
                            int anomalies,
                            int[] range)
        constructor for data sets with anomalies
        Parameters:
        features - : (int) number of channels/features of the data set (default value: 30)
        sequenceLength - : (int) number of temporal observations per channel/feature (default value: 20000)
        anomalies - : (int) number of anomalies to be added to the data set (default value: 0)
        range - : (int[2]) duration range of each anomaly [min, max] (default value: {30, 90})

      • MVTSDatasetGenerator

        public MVTSDatasetGenerator​(int features,
                            int sequenceLength)
        constructor for data sets with no anomaly
        Parameters:
        features - : (int) number of channels/features of the data set (default value 30)
        sequenceLength - : (int) number of temporal observations per channel/feature (default value 20000)

      • MVTSDatasetGenerator

        public MVTSDatasetGenerator()
        default data set constructor

        Parameters:

      • generateSingleTimeSeries

        public java.util.Vector<java.lang.Double> generateSingleTimeSeries()
        method that allows to generate a single time series the time series is randomly generated on the basis of a coin toss strategy that leverages the 0/1 variable sRand: - when sRand is 0 the time series is computed as sin[(t-t0)/w] + lambda * epsilon - when sRand is 1 the time series is computed as cos[(t-t0)/w] + lambda * epsilon
        Returns:
        the time series (Vector of Double)

      • generateDataset

        public java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.Double>> generateDataset()
        method that allows to generate the multi-variate time series data set the method also checks if it is required the introductio of anomalies and randomly adds them to the series accordingly to the settings of the constructor
        Returns:
        the multivariate time series data set (Vector of Vectors of Double)

      • printParams

        public void printParams()
        method that allows to print the information about the constructor's settings

      • printDataset

        public void printDataset​(java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.Double>> dataset)
        method that allows to print the data set content

      • saveDataset

        public void saveDataset​(java.lang.String filename,
                        java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.Double>> dataset)
        method that allows to save the data set into a csv file
        Parameters:
        filename - (String) the name of the dataset without extension
        dataset - ((Vector of Vectors of Double)) the data set generated
